name: Rectosigmoid Junction Stricture with Ischemic Colitis
chief_complaint: Severe abdominal pain and inability to pass stool for 4 days
treatment: possible surgical resection if ischemia progresses
prognosis: Guarded - depends on extent of ischemic damage and stricture etiology
description: A complex condition involving both mechanical obstruction at the rectosigmoid junction and secondary ischemic changes due to compromised blood flow. Often caused by chronic inflammation, radiation injury, or vascular insufficiency. The dual pathology creates diagnostic and therapeutic challenges.
multiple_choice: Rectosigmoid Junction Stricture with Ischemic Colitis
